creator: ckimyt@yahoo.com
text:
This may not be the appropriate forum for this bug, because who knows what Sun
has done to the Tomcat 4.0b1 engine embedding it in their J2EE 1.3 release.

Anyhow, I've run into a problem J2EE 1.2 with Tomcat 3.0 didn't have:  the login
page for realm authentication doesn't seem to work.

I package the recommended HTML or JSP form (exemplified in Java Pet Store 1.1.2)
and set it as the login form in the security settings in deploytool.

When it's protecting a resource, I get the login form displayed.  When I enter a
valid user/password for the resource (verified by a standalone client), I get an
absolutely blank page.  No error in the catalina log, no exception in the j2ee
-verbose window, nothing.  (Netscape pops up the error that the document
contains no data).

This exact same app works properly in J2EE 1.2.1 with Tomcat 3.0...once the user
is authenticated, the requested page appears with authorization.

Any ideas?

creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
text:
There are essentially no changes between the Tomcat 4 that you can download
standalone and that included in J2SDKEE 1.3 -- at least, as of the date that the
rev was frozen.  Can you try this with J2SDKEE 1.3 beta 2?

Current Tomcat 4 code (which will be integrated into the final release of
J2SDKEE1.3) performs form-based login exactly per the Servlet 2.3 PFD3 spec, and
passes the relevant security-related tests.
